unnormalised: Okay, so there's been a slight uptick in dengue cases in Mumbai, guys. BMC officials are saying it's nothing to panic about yet, but we should all be extra careful. They've already fogged areas like Andheri and Bandra, where they saw a spike. Last week alone, I heard there were like, 75 new cases reported. Not good, right?
normalised: Okay, so there's been a slight uptick in dengue cases in Mumbai, guys. B-M-C officials are saying it's nothing to panic about yet, but we should all be extra careful. They've already fogged areas like Andheri and Bandra, where they saw a spike. Last week alone, I heard there were like, seventy five new cases reported. Not good, right?

unnormalised: Dr. Sharma at Lilavati Hospital mentioned that most cases are mild, with typical symptoms like fever, body ache, and rash. But he stressed that early diagnosis is key. If you're feeling unwell, don't just pop a Crocin 500mg and hope for the best. Get tested, okay? You can usually get a dengue test done for around Rs. 1500 at most private labs.
normalised: Doctor Sharma at Lilavati Hospital mentioned that most cases are mild, with typical symptoms like fever, body ache, and rash. But he stressed that early diagnosis is key. If you're feeling unwell, don't just pop a Crocin five hundred milligram and hope for the best. Get tested, okay? You can usually get a dengue test done for around rupee one thousand five hundred at most private labs.

unnormalised: Also, and this is super important, prevent mosquito breeding. Empty out any stagnant water around your house. Flower pots, old tires, coolers - theyâ€™re all breeding grounds! The govt is running campaigns, but honestly, it's up to all of us to do our part. Stay safe, and spread the word!
normalised: Also, and this is super important, prevent mosquito breeding. Empty out any stagnant water around your house. Flower pots, old tires, coolers - they're all breeding grounds! The government is running campaigns, but honestly, it's up to all of us to do our part. Stay safe, and spread the word!
